confirmation.clear: Are you sure you want to clear the content? This action cannot be undone.

filters.title: Content Filter Explanation
filters.numbers:
This rule filters out text that consists entirely of numbers, currency symbols, thousands separators, and percentage signs.

More Examples:
‚Ä¢ "-1,234.56"
‚Ä¢ "¬•999"
‚Ä¢ "(‚Ç¨200)"
‚Ä¢ "+100%"
filters.chinese:
This rule filters out text that consists entirely of Chinese characters, excluding any punctuation or spaces.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "‰Ω†Â•Ω‰∏ñÁïå" (will be filtered)
‚Ä¢ "‰Ω†Â•ΩÔºå‰∏ñÁïå" (will not be filtered)
filters.contains_chinese:
This rule filters out any text that contains at least one Chinese character, regardless of other characters.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "‰Ω†Â•Ω World" (will be filtered)
‚Ä¢ "Chapter 1" (will be filtered, as 'Á¨¨ 1 Á´†' contains 'Á¨¨' and 'Á´†')
filters.emoji_only:
This rule filters out text that consists entirely of one or more emoji characters.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "üëç"
‚Ä¢ "üòäüéâüöÄ"
filters.symbols:
This rule filters out text that consists entirely of various punctuation and symbols.

More Examples:
‚Ä¢ "@#*&^%"
‚Ä¢ "()[]{}"
‚Ä¢ "---...---"
filters.term:
This rule filters out common UI terms that typically do not require translation.

More Examples:
‚Ä¢ "OK", "Cancel", "Submit"
‚Ä¢ "Login", "Settings", "Help"
filters.single_letter:
This rule filters out text consisting of a single English letter, case-insensitive.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "A" (will be filtered)
‚Ä¢ "b" (will be filtered)
‚Ä¢ "AB" (will not be filtered)
filters.repeating_chars:
This rule filters out text composed of the same character repeating 3 or more times consecutively.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "======"
‚Ä¢ "bbbbb"
‚Ä¢ "...."
filters.file_paths:
This rule attempts to identify and filter out text that resembles operating system file paths or URLs.

More Examples:
‚Ä¢ "/path/to/file.js"
‚Ä¢ "C:\Users\Test"
filters.hex_color_codes:
This rule filters out standard CSS hexadecimal color codes (3 or 6 digits).

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "#FFFFFF"
‚Ä¢ "#ff0000"
‚Ä¢ "#f0c"
filters.email_addresses:
This rule filters out text that matches the standard format of an email address.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "example@domain.com"
‚Ä¢ "user.name@sub.domain.org"
filters.uuids:
This rule filters out Universally Unique Identifiers (UUIDs).

Example:
‚Ä¢ "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000"
filters.git_commit_hashes:
This rule filters out standard Git commit hashes (long or short).

Examples:
‚Ä¢ "a1b2c3d4e5f6a1b2c3d4e5f6a1b2c3d4e5f6a1b2"
‚Ä¢ "a1b2c3d"

display.title: Display Settings Explanation
display.show_fab:
Control whether to display the Floating Action Button (FAB) in the bottom-right corner of webpages. This serves as the primary entry point for both static and dynamic text extraction.

If you disable this button, you can re-enable it via the settings panel in the Tampermonkey extension menu.
display.show_scan_count: When enabled, the title bar of the results window will show a real-time count of the total text items found in the current scan. This is especially useful for monitoring the progress of a long-running Dynamic Scan.
display.show_line_numbers: Displays line numbers to the left of the text area in the results window. This provides a precise reference point when you need to discuss or note a specific line of text.
display.show_statistics: Displays real-time statistics about the extracted content in the status bar at the bottom of the results window, including total lines and total characters. This helps you quickly assess the volume of the content.
display.enable_word_wrap:
Controls how long lines of text are displayed in the results window.

‚Ä¢ Enabled: Long lines will wrap to fit the window's width.
‚Ä¢ Disabled: Long lines will remain on a single line, causing a horizontal scrollbar to appear.
display.text_truncation_limit:
This is a performance-saving feature. If the script extracts an extremely long single line of text (e.g., a base64 encoded image), it could cause the browser to lag or become unresponsive.

This setting truncates any single line exceeding the specified length to ensure the UI remains smooth. Note: This only affects the display; the exported file will still contain the full, untruncated content.

advanced.title: Advanced Settings Explanation
advanced.enable_debug_logging: When enabled, the script will output detailed internal status, execution steps, and error messages to the browser's Developer Tools Console (usually opened with F12). This is primarily for developers or users who need to submit detailed bug reports.
